intro: Farsetia cheiranthoides, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, with small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
